Tasks.Task Description: Set up either GitHub or Azure Repos for your source code control system. This choice will determine your choice of pipeline runner as well. GitHub can use Azure Pipelines or GitHub Actions, whereas Azure Repos must use Azure Pipelines.

Tasks.Task: Set up Azure API Management service
Tasks.Task Description: Set up an Azure API Management service for each API developer so that they can develop API definitions along with the API service. Use the consumption or developer SKU when creating the service.
Use policy fragments to reduce the new policy that developers need to write for each API.
Use named values and backends to ensure that policies are generic and can apply to any API Management instance.
Use the Azure APIOps Toolkit to extract a working API definition from the developer service.
Set up an API approval process that runs on each pull request. The API approval process should include breaking change detection, linting, and automated API testing.
Use the Azure APIOps Toolkit publisher to publish the API to your production API Management service.
Integrate with Azure Key Vault for secure safekeeping and management of client certificates and secrets.
Integrate with Azure Monitor for logging, reporting, and alerting on management operations, systems events, and API requests.
Integrate with Application Insights for live metrics, end-to-end tracing, and troubleshooting.
Set up network-level protection using virtual networks, private endpoints, and Application Gateway.
Set up developer authentication and request authorization using Microsoft Entra ID.
Integrate with Event Hubs for streaming events.

Tasks.Task: Deploy API definition using ARM templates
Tasks.Task Description: If using dotnet-apim, the API definition is represented as an ARM template. Tasks are available for Azure Pipelines and GitHub Actions to deploy an ARM template.
If using Terraform, CLI tools will deploy the API definition on your service. There are tasks available for Azure Pipelines and GitHub Actions.

Tasks.Task: Manage API Management using Azure Automation
Tasks.Task Description: API Management can be managed in Azure Automation by using the Windows PowerShell cmdlets for Azure API Management API.

Tasks.Task: Create an Azure API Management instance
Tasks.Task Description: Complete the quickstart to create an Azure API Management instance by using the Azure portal.
Customize the look and feel of the developer portal by adding custom content, customizing styles, and adding your branding.
Export APIs to the Power Platform for discovery and use by citizen developers.
Use the developer portal to read API documentation, call an API via the interactive console, create an account, and subscribe to get API keys.
